an2.130:1.1.pli: “Saddho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ sammā āyācamāno āyāceyya:

an2.130:1.2.eng: ‘May I be like Sāriputta and Moggallāna!’

an2.130:1.3.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, tulā etaṃ pamāṇaṃ mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ yadidaṃ sāriputtamoggallānā”ti.
an2.130:1.3.eng: These are a standard and a measure for my monk disciples, that is, Sāriputta and Moggallāna.”

an2.131:1.1.pli: “Saddhā, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī evaṃ sammā āyācamānā āyāceyya:

an2.131:1.2.pli: ‘tādisī homi yādisī khemā ca bhikkhunī uppalavaṇṇā cā’ti.
an2.131:1.2.eng: ‘May I be like the nuns Khemā and Uppalavaṇṇā!’

an2.131:1.3.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, tulā etaṃ pamāṇaṃ mama sāvikānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yadidaṃ khemā ca bhikkhunī uppalavaṇṇā cā”ti.
an2.131:1.3.eng: These are a standard and a measure for my nun disciples, that is, the nuns Khemā and Uppalavaṇṇā.”

an2.132:1.1.pli: “Saddho, bhikkhave, upāsako evaṃ sammā āyācamāno āyāceyya:

an2.132:1.2.pli: ‘tādiso homi yādiso citto ca gahapati hatthako ca āḷavako’ti.
an2.132:1.2.eng: ‘May I be like the householder Citta and Hatthaka of Āḷavī!’

an2.132:1.3.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, tulā etaṃ pamāṇaṃ mama sāvakānaṃ upāsakānaṃ yadidaṃ citto ca gahapati hatthako ca āḷavako”ti.
an2.132:1.3.eng: These are a standard and a measure for my male lay followers, that is, the householder Citta and Hatthaka of Āḷavī.”

an2.133:1.1.pli: “Saddhā, bhikkhave, upāsikā evaṃ sammā āyācamānā āyāceyya:

an2.133:1.2.pli: ‘tādisī homi yādisī khujjuttarā ca upāsikā veḷukaṇḍakiyā ca nandamātā’ti.
an2.133:1.2.eng: ‘May I be like the laywomen Khujjuttarā and Veḷukaṇṭakī, Nanda’s mother!’

an2.133:1.3.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, tulā etaṃ pamāṇaṃ mama sāvikānaṃ upāsikānaṃ yadidaṃ khujjuttarā ca upāsikā veḷukaṇḍakiyā ca nandamātā”ti.
an2.133:1.3.eng: These are a standard and a measure for my female lay disciples, that is, the laywomen Khujjuttarā and Veḷukaṇṭakī, Nanda’s mother.”

an2.134:1.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
an2.134:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person has two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an2.134:1.3.eng: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism

an2.134:1.4.eng: and they criticize those deserving of praise.

an2.134:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavatīti.
an2.134:1.5.eng: When a foolish, incompetent untrue person possesses these two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they create much wickedness.

an2.134:2.1.pli: Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavati.
an2.134:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person has two qualities they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.

an2.134:2.3.eng: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism

an2.134:2.4.eng: and they praise those deserving of praise.

an2.134:2.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
an2.134:2.5.eng: When an astute, competent true person possesses these two qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they create much merit.”

an2.135:1.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
an2.135:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person has two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an2.135:1.3.pli: Ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā appasādanīye ṭhāne pasādaṃ upadaṃseti,
an2.135:1.3.eng: Without examining or scrutinizing, they arouse faith in things that are dubious,

an2.135:1.4.pli: ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā pasādanīye ṭhāne appasādaṃ upadaṃseti.
an2.135:1.4.eng: and they don’t arouse faith in things that are inspiring.

an2.135:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavatīti.
an2.135:1.5.eng: When a foolish, incompetent untrue person possesses these two qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they create much wickedness.

an2.135:2.1.pli: Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavati.
an2.135:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person has two qualities they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.

an2.135:2.3.pli: Anuvicca pariyogāhetvā appasādanīye ṭhāne appasādaṃ upadaṃseti,
an2.135:2.3.eng: After examining or scrutinizing, they don’t arouse faith in things that are dubious,

an2.135:2.4.pli: anuvicca pariyogāhetvā pasādanīye ṭhāne pasādaṃ upadaṃseti.
an2.135:2.4.eng: and they do arouse faith in things that are inspiring.

an2.135:2.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
an2.135:2.5.eng: When an astute, competent true person possesses these two qualities they keep themselves healthy and whole. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they create much merit.”

an2.136:1.1.pli: “Dvīsu, bhikkhave, micchāpaṭipajjamāno bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
an2.136:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person acts wrongly toward two individuals they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an2.136:1.4.pli: Imesu kho, bhikkhave, dvīsu micchāpaṭipajjamāno bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavatīti.
an2.136:1.4.eng: When a foolish, incompetent untrue person acts wrongly toward these two individuals they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an2.136:2.1.pli: Dvīsu, bhikkhave, sammāpaṭipajjamāno paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavati.
an2.136:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person acts rightly toward two individuals they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.

an2.136:2.4.pli: Imesu kho, bhikkhave, dvīsu sammāpaṭipajjamāno paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
an2.136:2.4.eng: When an astute, competent true person acts rightly toward these two individuals they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.”

an2.137:1.1.pli: “Dvīsu, bhikkhave, micchāpaṭipajjamāno bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
an2.137:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person acts wrongly toward two individuals they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an2.137:1.3.eng: The Realized One and a disciple of the Realized One.

an2.137:1.4.pli: Imesu kho, bhikkhave, micchāpaṭipajjamāno bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavatīti.
an2.137:1.4.eng: When a foolish, incompetent untrue person acts wrongly toward these people they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an2.137:2.1.pli: Dvīsu, bhikkhave, sammāpaṭipajjamāno paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavati.
an2.137:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person acts rightly toward two individuals they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.

an2.137:2.3.eng: The Realized One and a disciple of the Realized One.

an2.137:2.4.pli: Imesu kho, bhikkhave, dvīsu sammāpaṭipajjamāno paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
an2.137:2.4.eng: When an astute, competent true person acts rightly toward these two individuals they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.”

an2.138:1.3.pli: Sacittavodānañca na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
an2.138:1.3.eng: Cleaning your own mind, and not grasping at anything in the world.

an2.141:1.3.eng: A gift of things of the flesh and a gift of the teaching.

an2.141:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ dānānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammadānan”ti.
an2.141:1.5.eng: The better of these two gifts is the gift of the teaching.”

an2.142:1.3.eng: An offering of things of the flesh and an offering of the teaching.

an2.142:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ yāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammayāgo”ti.
an2.142:1.5.eng: The better of these two offerings is an offering of the teaching.”

an2.143:1.1.eng: “There are these two acts of generosity.

an2.143:1.3.eng: Generosity with things of the flesh and generosity with the teaching.

an2.143:1.4.eng: These are the two acts of generosity.

an2.143:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ cāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammacāgo”ti.
an2.143:1.5.eng: The better of these two acts of generosity is generosity with the teaching.”

an2.144:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of charity.

an2.144:1.3.eng: Charity in things of the flesh and charity in the teaching.

an2.144:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of charity.

an2.144:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ pariccāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammapariccāgo”ti.
an2.144:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of charity is a charity in the teaching.”

an2.145:1.3.eng: Riches in things of the flesh and riches in the teaching.

an2.145:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ bhogānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammabhogo”ti.
an2.145:1.5.eng: The better of these two riches is riches in the teaching.”

an2.146:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of enjoyment.

an2.146:1.3.eng: Enjoyment of things of the flesh and enjoyment of the teaching.

an2.146:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of enjoyment.

an2.146:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sambhogānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasambhogo”ti.
an2.146:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of enjoyment is the enjoyment of the teaching.”

an2.147:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of sharing.

an2.147:1.3.eng: Sharing things of the flesh and sharing the teaching.

an2.147:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of sharing.

an2.147:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ saṃvibhāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasaṃvibhāgo”ti.
an2.147:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of sharing is sharing the teaching.”

an2.148:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of inclusion.

an2.148:1.3.eng: Inclusion in things of the flesh and inclusion in the teaching.

an2.148:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of inclusion.

an2.148:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ saṅgahānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasaṅgaho”ti.
an2.148:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of inclusion is inclusion in the teaching.”

an2.149:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of support.

an2.149:1.3.eng: Support in things of the flesh and support in the teaching.

an2.149:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of support.

an2.149:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ anuggahānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammānuggaho”ti.
an2.149:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of support is support in the teaching.”

an2.150:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of sympathy.

an2.150:1.3.eng: Sympathy in things of the flesh and sympathy in the teaching.

an2.150:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of sympathy.

an2.150:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ anukampānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammānukampā”ti.
an2.150:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of sympathy is sympathy in the teaching.”

an2.151:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of welcome.

an2.151:1.3.eng: Welcome in things of the flesh and welcome in the teaching.

an2.151:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of welcome.

an2.151:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ santhārānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasanthāro”ti.
an2.151:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of welcome is the welcome in the teaching.”

an2.152:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of hospitality.

an2.152:1.3.eng: Hospitality in things of the flesh and hospitality in the teaching.

an2.152:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of hospitality.

an2.152:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ paṭisanthārānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammapaṭisanthāro”ti.
an2.152:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of hospitality is hospitality in the teaching.”

an2.153:1.3.eng: The quest for things of the flesh and the quest for the teaching.

an2.153:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ esanānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammesanā”ti.
an2.153:1.5.eng: The better of these two quests is the quest for the teaching.”

an2.154:1.3.eng: The search for things of the flesh and the search for the teaching.

an2.154:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ pariyesanānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammapariyesanā”ti.
an2.154:1.5.eng: The better of these two searches is the search for the teaching.”

an2.155:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of seeking.

an2.155:1.3.eng: Seeking for things of the flesh and seeking for the teaching.

an2.155:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of seeking.

an2.155:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ pariyeṭṭhīnaṃ yadidaṃ dhammapariyeṭṭhī”ti.
an2.155:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of seeking is seeking for the teaching.”

an2.156:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of worship.

an2.156:1.3.eng: Worship of things of the flesh and worship of the teaching.

an2.156:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of worship.

an2.156:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ pūjānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammapūjā”ti.
an2.156:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of worship is worship of the teaching.”

an2.157:1.1.eng: “There are these two ways of serving guests.

an2.157:1.3.eng: Serving guests with things of the flesh and serving guests with the teaching.

an2.157:1.4.eng: These are the two ways of serving guests.

an2.157:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ ātitheyyānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammātitheyyan”ti.
an2.157:1.5.eng: The better of these two ways of serving guests is to serve them with the teaching.”

an2.158:1.3.eng: Success in things of the flesh and success in the teaching.

an2.158:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ iddhīnaṃ yadidaṃ dhammiddhī”ti.
an2.158:1.5.eng: The better of these two successes is success in the teaching.”

an2.159:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of growth.

an2.159:1.3.eng: Growth in things of the flesh and growth in the teaching.

an2.159:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of growth.

an2.159:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ dvinnaṃ vuddhīnaṃ yadidaṃ dhammavuddhī”ti.
an2.159:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of growth is growth in the teaching.”

an2.160:1.3.eng: The treasure of things of the flesh and the treasure of the teaching.

an2.160:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ ratanānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammaratanan”ti.
an2.160:1.5.eng: The better of these two treasures is the treasure of the teaching.”

an2.161:1.1.eng: “There are these two kinds of accumulation.

an2.161:1.3.eng: Accumulation of things of the flesh and accumulation of the teaching.

an2.161:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of accumulation.

an2.161:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ sannicayānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasannicayo”ti.
an2.161:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of accumulation is the accumulation of the teaching.”

an2.162:1.1.eng: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of increase.

an2.162:1.3.eng: Increase in things of the flesh and increase in the teaching.

an2.162:1.4.eng: These are the two kinds of increase.

an2.162:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ vepullānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammavepullan”ti.
an2.162:1.5.eng: The better of these two kinds of increase is increase in the teaching.”

an2.163:1.3.eng: Skill in meditative attainments and skill in emerging from those attainments.

an2.168:1.3.pli: Indriyesu aguttadvāratā ca bhojane amattaññutā ca.
an2.168:1.3.eng: Not guarding the sense doors and eating too much.

an2.169:1.3.pli: Indriyesu guttadvāratā ca bhojane mattaññutā ca.
an2.169:1.3.eng: Guarding the sense doors and moderation in eating.

an2.170:1.3.eng: The power of reflection and the power of development.

an2.171:1.3.eng: The power of mindfulness and the power of immersion.

an2.173:1.3.eng: Failure in ethical conduct and failure in view.

an2.174:1.3.eng: Accomplishment in ethical conduct and accomplishment in view.

an2.175:1.3.eng: Purification of ethics and purification of view.

an2.176:1.3.eng: Purification of view and making an effort in line with that view.

an2.177:1.3.pli: Asantuṭṭhitā ca kusalesu dhammesu, appaṭivānitā ca padhānasmiṃ.
an2.177:1.3.eng: To never be content with skillful qualities, and to never stop trying.

an2.178:1.3.eng: Lack of mindfulness and lack of situational awareness.
